# Custom

Custom resource allow you to store multiple files from one source request

{
  name: 'my-resource',
  maxAge: 3600,
  init: ({ store }) => {
    const ctx = { id: 'REF' }
    const path = `test/test-${ctx.id}.json`

    return store({ path, ctx, identifier: ctx.id })
  },
  request: ({ id }) => ({
    method: 'get',
    url: 'http://www.mocky.io/v2/5d9e4c643200002a00329d0a',
    params: {
      id
    }
  }),
  middleware: {
    /* eslint-disable-next-line */
    path: '/test/:id',
    handler: async (params, { get, store }) => {
      const ctx = { id: params.id }
      const path = `test/test-${ctx.id}.json`

      if (ctx.id === '123') {
        console.log('throw error')
        throw Error('Resource not found')
      }

      return get(path) || store({ path, ctx, identifier: ctx.id })
    }
  },
  catch: []
}

will call the resource http://www.mocky.io/v2/5d9e4c643200002a00329d0a at nuxt start with query param id=REF and will write the file test/test-REF.json to the filesystem and expose the route to http://hostname:port/rootUrl/test/test-{id}.json with param id
